intro: Tricalysia dewevrei, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and landscapes.
